result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin Anthony Zillges Kreger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Devin Anthony Zillges Kreger in court with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called: 14CM715, 14CM723, 14CM358, 15CF118, 15CF317, 14CF366.  In 15CF317 waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 1,3,4,5, & 6 dismissed but read in.  On ct. 2 court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  Conditions of probation include: 3 months jail, imposed and stayed used at the agents discretion.  Defendant must remain in the journey program.  Continue vivital treatment   $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  In 14CF366 defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 3 years. Conditions of probation include: 3 months jail, imposed and stayed at the agents discretion.  Defendant must remain in the journey program.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  14CM715, 14CM358, 15CF118- 13 days credit, 14CM723 all dismissed but read in.   Continue vivitol treatment.  6 month review.  Defendant is to report to probation by 1 pm 12-4-15.   Cash bond on hand will be applied towards the costs.
Atty Tristan Eagon

Cases called: 14CF366, 14CM715, 14CM358, 14CM723, 15CF118, 15CF317, Defendant Devin Anthony Zillges Kreger in court, in custody with attorney Adam Raabe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $5,000 recog. bond with Maintain absolute sobriety. Time limits waived.  Cases track with.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 01:50 pm.  Return date scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus for Dane County Jail on 10/1/15 at 2:45 P.M.

Attorney Adam Raabe appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CF366, 14CM358, 14CM715, 14CM723, & 15CF118.  Defendant is in Dane County Jail.  State has revoked the offer that was made.  Atty Raabe requested a new pretrial and return for all cases.  State had no objection.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 02:50 pm.  Return date scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Attorney Adam Raabe appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF118, 14CM358, 14CF366, 14CM715, & 14CM723.  DA Kohlwey stated that Atty Raabe had stated prior to todays hearing, that he does not have a current address for defendant and was unable to let him know of the rescheduling of this matter.  Some of the cases have a return date of 8/13/15 set. Requested these matter be reset to that date as well, since defendant is aware of that return date.  Atty Raabe agreed with statement.  Court granted request, all matters to be on for 8/13/15 returns.
Discovery letter filed by ADA Crystal Long
in regards to 7/17/15 trial date.   Filed by Atty Adam Raabe
plea/sentence 7-14-15 @ 2:45 p.m.

Defendant Devin Anthony Zillges Kreger in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Reset requested.  Return date scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
